TopicTitle: How do I make a file?

Articles.Content:
With the advent of .15 and the IO namespace forbidden... how do you write to a file? I have a Dictionary<string, int=""> that\'d I\'d like to write to and read from, but I can\'t figure out how to do it with the new API.</string,>

In the past I used a BinaryFormatter to serialize it to a file, but that requires streams from System.IO. Is there a drop-in replacement, or will I need to do something else?
Look at the unofficial Wiki (sry. no link here). There seems to be a replacement for BinaryFormatter in KSP.IO, but I don\'t really know about the whole file thing.
Yeah, I read through the wiki, but still don\'t understand what steps I need to take.

> 
> With the advent of .15 and the IO namespace forbidden... how do you write to a file? I have a Dictionary<string, int=""> that\'d I\'d like to write to and read from, but I can\'t figure out how to do it with the new API.</string,>
> 
> In the past I used a BinaryFormatter to serialize it to a file, but that requires streams from System.IO. Is there a drop-in replacement, or will I need to do something else?

You can serialize it using [IOTools](http://kspwiki.nexisonline.net/wiki/IOTools) and then write it to disk with [File](http://kspwiki.nexisonline.net/wiki/File).WriteAllBytes.

    byte[] buffer = IOTools.SerializeToBinary(dictionary);File.WriteAllBytes(buffer,'filename.bin');

The serialize/deserialize methods in IOTools use BinaryFormatter.
